intro: Tragia hildebrandtii subsp. glaucescens, commonly known as the blue-green tragia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves that often appear bluish-green due to a waxy coating. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in well-drained soils. This subspecies is often found in rocky or disturbed habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environmental conditions.
